translation: Whoever knows it to be indestructible, eternal, unborn, and inexhaustible, how can that person slay, O Arjuna, or cause to be slain?
commentary: 2.21 Veda knows? indestructible indestructible? Eternally eternal? who who? Anam this (Self)? Ajam unborn? Infinitive inexhaustible? How how? Sah he (that)? The man is man? Partha O Partha (son of Pritha)? Kam whom? kills causes to be slain? kills kills? Kam whom.Commentary The enlightened sage who knows the immutable and indestructible Self through direct cognition or spiritual Anubhava (experience) cannot do the act of slaying. He cannot cause another to slay also.
